articles.title: Nationwide: House prices rise at fastest pace for six years - This is Money
articles.description: The rush to beat the stamp duty holiday deadline drove up the market, with experts describing a 'mad stampede' before the nine-month break ends on paying the fee on the first £500,000 of homes.
articles.content: House prices have risen at the fastest pace for nearly six years last month with mortgage approvals hitting a six-month high, it emerged today as buyers continue to flee cities in favour of homes in … [+10868 chars]
